content.p: We are a collection of research teams working on duckweeds. Duckweeds are the smallest and the fastest-growing flowering plants on Earth. Due to their simple body plan and ease of growth, they provide a highly tractable experimental model for asking fundamental biological questions. Their rapid growth and high protein content position duckweed as a future food and a chassis for synthetic biology. Collectively, our interests span both fundamental and applied research questions. RNASeq (GEO) GSE226143 RNASeq (GEO) GSE225923 Link to come We routinely use the following material Pistia stratoides, Spirodela polyrhiza (line 9509) and Wolffia australiana (line 8720).
